title: Might
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                 |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | You are unnaturally mighty, doing significantly more damage in physical combat. |

**Might** is a [status effect](/Status_effect "Status effect") and monster-only spell that increases melee damage for its duration.

## Contents

- [1 Effect](#Effect)

  - [1.1 Player](#Player)
  - [1.2 Monster](#Monster)

- [2 Sources](#Sources)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 Monster Spell](#Monster_Spell)

- [5 History](#History)

## Effect

### Player

Adds +1d10 damage to melee and each [auxiliary attack](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack"), except [constriction](/Constriction "Constriction").

This is considered separate from the effective enchantment roll ([slaying](/Slaying "Slaying") + to-damage of your weapon). When compared to having +10 slaying, might gives a more consistent roll. Having 10 slay and might (1d10 + 1d10) is more consistent than 20 slaying (1d20). However, unlike slaying, might does not give an [accuracy](/Accuracy "Accuracy") bonus, thus making it weaker than +10 slay.

### Monster

Monsters get +50% damage in melee. This is often stronger than the player effect, so exercise caution around mighted monsters.

## Sources

The possible sources for Might are:

- [Potions of might](/Potions_of_might "Potions of might").
  - Also available through Gozag's [Potion Petition](/Gozag#Given_Abilities "Gozag").
- The [Demonspawn mutation](/Demonspawn_mutation "Demonspawn mutation") [Powered by Pain](/Powered_by_Pain "Powered by Pain") can cause a might effect.
- [Xom](/Xom "Xom") and [chaos](/Chaos "Chaos") effects can inflict might.

[Berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") includes a might effect. While berserk, might has no additional effect.

## Strategy

Might is useful for dealing with monsters that are troublesome, but for which [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk") or [haste](/Haste "Haste") would be overkill and/or unsafe - compared to those, might has no real drawbacks and is safe to use. Unfortunately, as it is only easily available through a [potion](/Potion "Potion"), the uses are limited. Since might increases your combat ability, use it early in a fight - you'll get more out of might at 100% HP than 50% HP.

Might is a 'flat' damage boost, so it has a more pronounced effect on [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades") and other fast weapons. It can let a [quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade") punch through high [AC](/AC "AC") foes, for instance. It's also disproportionately strong with [auxiliary attacks](/Auxiliary_attack "Auxiliary attack"); e.g. monstrous [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") and worshippers of [Jiyva](/Jiyva "Jiyva") can get +2d10 to +4d10 damage per round.

Even casters will want to keep around potions of might, in cases where they run out of MP.

## Monster Spell

Monsters can cast the Might spell to induce the effect on themselves. They can also use [Might Other](/Might_Other "Might Other") to induce it on a single other monster, or [Battlecry](/Battlecry "Battlecry") to induce it on all nearby monsters of the same [genus](/Type "Type").

The following enemies cast Might:

- z [![Antique champion.png](/images/d/d7/Antique_champion.png)](/File:Antique_champion.png) **[Antique champion](/Antique_champion "Antique champion")**
- @ [![Donald.png](/images/6/6f/Donald.png)](/File:Donald.png) **[Donald](/Donald "Donald")**
- X [![Mlioglotl.png](/images/4/4d/Mlioglotl.png)](/File:Mlioglotl.png) **[Mlioglotl](/Mlioglotl "Mlioglotl")**
- X [![Thrashing horror.png](/images/1/17/Thrashing_horror.png)](/File:Thrashing_horror.png) **[Thrashing horror](/Thrashing_horror "Thrashing horror")**

The following enemies cast Might Other:

- T [![Deep troll shaman.png](/images/4/4c/Deep_troll_shaman.png)](/File:Deep_troll_shaman.png) **[Deep troll shaman](/Deep_troll_shaman "Deep troll shaman")**
- p [![Ironbound convoker.png](/images/2/27/Ironbound_convoker.png)](/File:Ironbound_convoker.png) **[Ironbound convoker](/Ironbound_convoker "Ironbound convoker")**

## History

- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), Might provided a +5 bonus to [Strength](/Strength "Strength").
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), the player could get the Might status effect by drawing a [Potion card](/Potion_card "Potion card").
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), extending might through further quaffing of potions would inflict one point of [magic contamination](/Magic_contamination "Magic contamination").
- Prior to [0.8](/0.8 "0.8"), you could get Might as an [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru") ability.
- Prior to [0.3](/0.3 "0.3"), you could get Might as a [Trog](/Trog "Trog") ability.
